Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Public class Board represents our field on which pieces are moved. Board is 2D integer array, where each integer is mapped for different piece. It's used to store position of each piece for possibility of tracking their movements across the board and registering when different events occur. Events such as pirate and island collision, pirate and player , etc..
    Since:
    18/1/2019
    Version:
    1.0.0 (alfa)
    Author:
    Mirnel Bucan

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) int[][] board
      int[][]board is our matrix for storing information about position of each piece
      (package private) static int dimCol
      dimCol is number of columns for board
      (package private) static int dimRow
      dimRow is number of rows for board
      (package private) static int EMPTY
      EMPTY is a constant representing empty field on board
      (package private) static int ISLAND
      ISLAND is a constant representing island on board
      (package private) static int PIRATES
      PIRATE is a constant representing pirate on board
      (package private) static int PORTAL
      PORTAL is a constant representing "passage to next level of game" on board
      (package private) static int SHIP
      SHIP is a constant representing player on board
      (package private) static int WRECK
      WRECk is a constant representing when 2 pirates collide field on board

      • setShip

        boolean setShip(int row,
                int col)
        Function for placing player on board
        Parameters:
        col - Represents on which column to place player
        row - Represents on which row to place player
        Returns:
        boolean Returns false if player isn't colliding with anything on board, true if player collides with anything on board

      • setPirate

        Parameters:

        row - Represents on which row to place player
        Returns:

        void removeShip(int row,
                int col)
        This function is used to remove ship from board
        Parameters:
        row - Represents in which row is player currently placed
        col - Represents in which column is player currently placed

        void removePirate(int row,

        col - Represents in which column is pirate/computer currently placed

      • checkInitPirates

        boolean checkInitPirates(int row,
                         int col)
        This function is used for initialization phase, to make sure we don't place pirate over pirate, pirate over island, etc...
        Parameters:
        row - Represents row in which we are checking
        col - Represents column in which we are checking
        Returns:
        boolean Returns true if that field is empty, false if anything else

        This function is used to print current board state to console
